This full color battlemap is the 311th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a small smithy.

The map is 14 x 10 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 2 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 2016x1440 pixels in size at 144dpi.

204752.name: The Whisper Out of Time
204752.description:
From publisher blurb:

With their memories once again intact, the adventurers continue their pursuit of Count Lowls after hearing that he’s set course for a lost city in a remote part of Casmaron called the Parchlands. On the race to find the wayward count before he does something terrible, the adventurers must first visit Cassomir where they believe he is meeting with an old associate, but find only danger in his absence. Then, they travel to Katheer, capital city of Qadira, to track down a blasphemous tome in a hidden library in order to find details of the count’s destination. Finally with the information in hand, they venture to the slave-trading city of Okeno for the final piece of the puzzle and where they meet a mysterious and alien ally. The race is on to stop their crazed nemesis and learn more about his loathsome plans before they stumble onto something too large to tackle!

“The Whisper Out of Time” is a Pathfinder Roleplaying Game adventure for 10th-level characters. The adventure continues the Strange Aeons Adventure Path, a twisted delve into madness that pits the heroes against the cosmic horrors of the Cthulhu Mythos. A selection of new monsters, an ecology of the yithian, a gazetteer of the city of Okeno, and the next installment of a new Pathfinder’s Journal round out this volume of the Pathfinder Adventure Path.

204753.name: What Grows Within
204753.description:
From publisher blurb:

After finding the route to the lost city of Neruzavin, the adventurers must mount an expedition into the vast and deadly desert region called the Parchlands, where they hope to catch up to their treacherous former employer. They brave the deadly desert to arrive in an abandoned city at the edge of a lake where a Great Old One slumbers. The adventurers must track Count Lowls’s party, recover a vile tome, activate the city’s Star Stelae, and perform a powerful ritual that allows them to follow the Count to Carcosa. Along the way the characters must be careful they don’t wake the slumbering Great Old One or stir up the flying polyps sealed beneath the city.

“What Grows Within” is a Pathfinder Roleplaying Game adventure for 13th-level characters. The adventure continues the Strange Aeons Adventure Path, a twisted delve into madness that pits the heroes against the cosmic horrors of the Cthulhu Mythos. A selection of new monsters, details on the great old one Xhamen-Dor, a look at the Necronomicon, and the next installment of a new Pathfinder’s Journal round out this volume of the Pathfinder Adventure Path.

204754.name: Black Stars Beckon
204754.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Strange Aeons Adventure Path draws to a stunning conclusion! Arriving in the alien city of Carcosa, the adventurers must sever the links that bind Carcosa to Golarion. In wandering the parasitic city the characters navigate the frozen ruins of an elder thing city, deal with accursed partygoers in a reflection of an Azlanti city, and encounter a mute musician who can help them find their way in the maddening streets of lost Carcosa. Can the heroes keep Carcosa from drawing Thrushmoor into its amalgam of stolen cities or do they risk waking the unspeakable nightmare that stirs in the depths of Lake Hali? They must break these links—or Golarion is doomed to greet the King in Yellow.

“Black Stars Beckon” is a Pathfinder Roleplaying Game adventure for 15th-level characters. The adventure continues the Strange Aeons Adventure Path, a twisted delve into madness that pits the heroes against the cosmic horrors of the Cthulhu Mythos. A selection of new monsters, a look into the past of Golarion, ideas for further adventures beyond the bounds of the Strange Aeons campaign, and the final installment of a new Pathfinder’s Journal round out this volume of the Pathfinder Adventure Path.

204755.description:
On the Island of Nowhere Atoll, terrifying (but utterly harmless) beasts reside. Can you wrangle the best sets of monsters, nurture them by collecting their favorite foods, and present the most horrifying group of monsters ever seen on the Island? Do so and you may just be named the new Island Protector...

In Isle of Monsters, a set collection, resource-gathering family game, 2-5 players take the role of monster wranglers attempting to gather the scariest team of monsters they can find in order to compete in the local Scare Faire. Getting screams from the audience gets you acclaim, as does scaring the monsters owned by other players.

Each round, players claim monsters and attempt to feed them their favorite foods to get the beasts ready for the Scare Faire. Each monster that's fully fed by the end of a round goes into that player's hand and participates in the Scare Faire.

Once every player is finished claiming and feeding monsters, a Scare Faire is held. Each player chooses a single color of monster to play from their hand along with as many cards of that color as they wish. Once every player has chosen, the played cards are revealed simultaneously and the player with the highest scare total from their monsters gets three scream points. Players can also get bonus points for scaring other players' monsters or from having more monsters in hand than any other player.

Play continues until there are no more monsters available to replenish the monster decks on the island. The player with the most scream points is declared the victor and Island Protector!
204755.name: Isle of Monsters
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 32 : Spartacus Board Game Review + Black Maple Hill

204756.description: A red themed, offense focused expansion to A.D.A.P.T. Includes 5 new bodies, 8 new parts, and 3 status trackers. Also introduces Autotomy, Grab, Inking, Neg Lethality, and Oversize: (Location). Adds +1 player to the base game.
204756.name: A.D.A.P.T.: Cephalopod Expansion Pack

204757.description: A green-themed, defense-heavy expansion to A.D.A.P.T. Includes 5 new bodies, 8 new parts, and 3 status trackers. Also introduces metamorphosis and withdraw. Adds +1 player to the base game.
204757.name: A.D.A.P.T.: Reptile & Amphibian Expansion Pack

204758.description: A blue-themed, magical expansion to A.D.A.P.T. Includes 5 new bodies, 8 new parts, and 3 status trackers. Also introduces blast, changeling, immune: poison, oversize: (location), and shapeshifting.
204758.name: A.D.A.P.T.: Fantasy Expansion Pack

204759.name: Twin Princes
boardgamepublisher: siroup games (シロップゲームズ)
204759.description:
User summary
Twin Princes is 双子の王子 (Hutago no Ouji). Originally published in 2015, a new colour edition was made in 2016.

Long ago in a desert country, the Twin Princes decided to race for the right to the throne in a mutually agreeable method, in order not to cause a future struggle because of themselves.

Twin Princes is a card game for two players. There are six territory cards on the table, and players try to control them by placing influence cards on them. Each player also controls a Prince meeple, which move on the territories and affect the placement of cards.

A game consists of six round. Each round, five cards are drawn. One player (divider) split them into two groups, and the other (selector) takes one of these groups. The divider takes the rest. Then they take turns playing a card on a territory.

After sixth round, for each territory, count influence points each player has place on that territory. The player with highest influence controls the territory and scores victory points. The player with the highest total victory points wins the game.

Publisher's summary
テーマ
遠い昔砂漠の国。 双子の王子は 自分たちが原因で争いが起きないよう、お互いが納得できる形で 王位継承権を競ったのです。

遊び方
２人専用のゲームです。
分配者と選択者になります、分配者が５枚のカードを２つに分けて、選択者が選び、手札にします。残った方を分配者が手札にします。
分配者から順番にカードをプレイします。エリアとカードのマジョリティを競います
分配者を交代して６ラウンド行います。
終了時点で勝利点の多いプレイヤーが勝利します。

204760.description: A yellow-themed, replayablity-increasing expansion to A.D.A.P.T. Includes 15 new genetically-boosted guppies and 3 bonus guppies (red, blue, and green). Also introduces changeling, ferocious, genetic engineer, hearty, lethal, metamorphosis, oversize: (location), survivalist, and time turning.
204760.name: A.D.A.P.T.: Guppy Expansion Pack

204761.description: A black-themed biomechanical expansion to A.D.A.P.T. Includes 8 new parts, 3 new guppies, and 4 resistance trackers. Also introduces genetic boosts, blast, destined, energized, oversize: (location), shapeshift, shielded, targeting, and transmogrify.
204761.name: A.D.A.P.T.: Bio-Mech Expansion Pack

204762.name: Starsphere
204762.description:
User Summary

Using a bounding ball of light, you jump from waving platform to platform, timing your jump with the platforms bounce and arcing to pick up as many stars as possible.

204763.name: Bad Rats Show
204763.description:
Bad Rats Show is a physics puzzle game where the rats exact their bloody revenge against their main enemies: the Cats. Solve puzzles in 2D and 3D maps using physics, objects and specially trained Rats. All new Rats and Cats, but with the same classic and questionable Bad Rats humor.

Source: The Developer Website.

204764.description:
"I love this game, as you should if you had more than half a brain." - Albert Einstein

Space Vermin From Beyond! is a solitaire game (with two player action…I mean option) depicting the battles between the crack 124th Galactic Marine Raider Battalion (known as the “Old Reprobates”) and a swarm of alien parasites called Vermites (derogatively referred to as “Space Vermin” by the Marines). Space Vermin From Beyond! takes place on Beyond III, a planet known for its frogs, bogs and fogs.

Easy, fast and rated PG-12, Space Vermin From Beyond! is the second game in Hermann Luttmann’s extraterrestri-awesome Invaders from Dimension X! universe. Space Vermin From Beyond! equips you with; one map sheet (with two separate 12.5” x 18.5” color maps printed front and back), eighty-eight kick-a$$ counters, 2 separate Player’s Aid cards and a 16 page booklet, including 12 pages of rules, two Battle scenarios and one Campaign scenario. It uses a chit pull system to generate Random Events and regulate the direction of the Vermite horde. This randomness enhance the alien theme and culture-shock for us Earthlings!

Battling these nasty varmints on Beyond III may take up to 2 hours (depending on the scenario chosen). But there ain’t no “high-noon” in space, so you take your dang time. Bring a few D6, your spine, brains and guts to defeat these vile space insects and save the defenseless population of Beyond III from total extinction!
204764.name: Space Vermin From Beyond!

204765.name: Dreambreak
204765.description:
Dreambreak is an adventure set in an alternative post cold war USSR. A quirky and unique mix of clashing gameplay genres. Get fingered for murder in Soviet Russia without actually going there!

Source: The Developer Website.

204766.name: Go Mission: Space Travel
204766.description:
Your mission is to take down these invaders and prevent them from reaching our home planet.

Source: The Publisher Website.

204767.name: Extravaganza Rising
204767.description:
Fortune favors those bold enough to collect and train tiny monsters. Three brave souls boldly descend into a town ridden with monsters, allies and everything in between. Driven only by the promise of powerful trinkets, unlimited treasure and almost certain death, they venture on.

Source: The Game Website.

204768.name: Airship Asunder
204768.description:
Captain your vessel and fly the skies of adventure! Establish new colonies, build mighty empires, search for ancient relics, use powerful magic spells and battle evil forces on your quest to defeat the Pirate King!

Source: The Publisher Website.

204769.name: The Land of Eyas
204769.description:
Lost with no memory of where he is or how he got there, lead Eyas – a boy in a cat suit – on a quest to get home. But how do you know which way to go when you can’t tell which is up and which is down?

Source: The Game Website.

204770.name: SweatShop (2016)
204770.description:
User Summary

Clicking away, you put together a sweatshop, installing desks, hiring workers, and giving upgrades to increase their productivity in making clothes. As your business becomes lucrative, you can increase the speed of the walkers who gather in the clothes, increase the maximum number of clothes stored on desks, and even re-set the game with a bigger or faster work floor. While still basically a light clicker game on a 20 or 40 space grid, there are strategic decisions that make it more of a hybrid with management games.

204771.name: SUPERFIGHT
204771.description:
SUPERFIGHT is a hilarious card game based on fights between characters with superpowers and super problems. Players create fighters from the cards they draw, then verbally argue over who wins the fight!

Source: The Game Website.

204772.name: Sekwere
204772.description:
User Summary

Sekwere is a minimalistic puzzle game where you need to reproduce pattern provided by miniature square.

204773.name: The Wave
204773.description:
A hand sensing, light changing, exciting modular game system complete with 5 different modes! Wave your hand over the top to activate the 5 different sections. The 5 modes are Catch Me, Join, Remember, Follow, and DJ

Catch Me: A target color will appear. The five sections will blink on and off with different color lights. Every time the target color appears, move your hand over it to score!

Join: Your goal is to connect the two like colors that appear in the set of five within a few seconds. Wave your hand from the first color to the second to paint The Wave with that color and score!

Remember: A sequence of five lights will appear. After a few seconds the sequence will shuffle itself. By waving your hand from section to section, you can exchange the positions of colors. Recreate the original sequence in time to score!

Follow: The Wave will say a target color and present you with five lights. Wave your hand over the correct one to move to the next level. Each level's difficulty increases by increasing the amount of colors you need to remember in order while decreasing the time and shuffling up the lights each time you hit a correct color!

Make Music: A free play mode where you can make your own jams! Wave your hand over a section to turn it on, triggering a music loop to play until the section is turned off. Hold your hand over a section to play an alternate loop of the same type. Combine different music loops and explore the beginnings of becoming a new DJ!

204774.description: Contains all 5 of the 17-card expansions for A.D.A.P.T. in one box. Includes the Bio-Mech, Cephalopod, Fantasy, Reptile & Amphibian, and Guppy expansion packs. Also introduces Genetic Boosts, Blast, Destined, Energized, Oversize: (location), Shapeshift, Shielded, Targeting, Transmogrify, Autotomy, Grab, Inking, Neg Lethality, Changeling, Immune: Poison, Shapeshifting, Ferocious, Genetic Engineer, Hearty, Lethal, Metamorphosis, Survivalist, and Time Turning, and Withdraw. Adds +3 players to the base game.
204774.name: A.D.A.P.T. - 5-in-1 Expansion Pack

204776.name: The Turning Leaves
204776.description:
From the introduction:

Across the piece of paper, starting and ending at edges, draw one jaggedy line, one swooshy line, and one dashy line. They can intersect or not. Maybe they turn corners, that's fine. None may cross themselves.

204777.name: Winter for One
204777.description:
From the introduction:


I never wanted to be a soldier...



The wintertime has a certain beauty here...



I can't believe I volunteered for this...

204778.name: What's the Frequency, Kenneth?
204778.description:
User summary:

This solitaire roleplaying game uses random internet articles (generally, derived from current events news feeds) to provide input into the narrative development. The articles selected must be "decoded" into their actual meaning (which is well hidden) by the player.

204779.name: Tyler
204779.description:
User Summary

You join together coloured spots to elevate them and take the key for the puzzle. Obstacles and bombs must be removed to complete the puzzle.

204780.name: Fire Sale
204780.description:
(Fire Sale is still in alpha testing / early production).

"You have stumbled upon the news that there is a fire sale going on at a bankrupt estate a few blocks away. They are selling priceless antiques off at insane prices! You gathered all the cash you could and ran to the now defunct mansion. Little did you know however that tons of people would show up, all with huge wads of cash, ready to outbid you on all these “priceless” treasures!"

Fire Sale is playable at home with 2 decks of cards, 5 dice per player, and rules (in Files section). Fire Sale is a 2-4 player game featuring auction/bidding based dice placement/manipulation and set collection. Over multiple rounds players must use their dice rolls wisely to try and buy cards from the center of the table to earn sets that they can trade in for victory points!

The first player is chosen by whoever rolls the lowest amount of the lowest die value and on each turn a player has 7 possible actions to choose from, 5 being their available "main" actions and 2 being possible free actions. These actions include the ability to buy cards (to form sets), bid on cards against your opponents, play cards from your hand, turn in cards to earn points, or discard cards to get new cards in your hand. The free actions include re-rolling and "flipping" your dice. The game requires efficient use of a player's five dice that are rolled each round, in which "opposite" faced die are very valuable, though each player has ways to influence their dice rolls in tactical ways to suit their needs.

During the game players make moves with their dice, play cards from their hand, and turn in their collected sets for points. Players can use the point "pool" wisely to gain extra points while also blocking their opponents from gaining extra points. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins!

204781.name: Five Nights at Freddy's: Sister Location
videogamehonor: 2016 Global Game Awards Best Horror Game of the Year Nominee
204781.description:
User Summary

It is the first installment of the series to be given a subtitle.

204782.name: Faery Wedding Reception
204782.description:
From the introduction:

Queen Luella is ecstatic her son is getting married. The peace treaty she could give or take, but having her son tied to actual responsibility has been her goal for over two years now. She sees him as a good man who only needs a little responsibility to make him a great one. She has known Breena since she was a little girl and has always admired her spirit. She requested Breena as Prince Kheelan’s wife from King Orin because she knew she was a woman after her own heart. She sees Breena as a fitting replacement for herself more than she does her own son. She admires Breena’s willingness to marry for peace, and despises her son’s lack of it.

204783.name: Sandbox Like
204783.description:
From the introduction:

In play, the Adventuring Party will set forth from their home base, travel the countryside, fight monsters and bandits in the countryside, find ruins and explore the lost places below. With skill and luck they will return home. Their adventures will be chronicled and their heroic deeds told throughout the land

At its core, this is a campaign simulation. Few individual actions will matter much including the death of a character, the important thing is the grand story we make from these tiny actions. The goal of the game is to traverse 10 adventures.

The leader for the round decides which order the party is in and what direction they will take and what they will explore. The other players have input, but the final decision is that of the party leader. The player sitting opposite the Party Leader will take the part of Chronicler. In a three player game the Chronicler will be the person to the right of the Party leader.

204784.name: Dragon and Warrior (2011)
204784.description:
User summary:

The game document includes one page of print-and-play components, including a (small) character sheet and three "Explain Cards". The game is fairly simple and requires exactly four players - each assumes a specific function within the game.

204785.name: Chicks with Disks
204785.description:
From the game:

Youʼll want to define your characters before starting. [Y]ou can define why they are undertaking this mission [before the game], or you can wait until the complex is defined.

As you move through the complex, youʼll be defining its rooms one by one. If youʼd like to form a general concept for the complex, disk, and means of entry and escape before you start defining rooms, do this as a group before the first player takes their first turn.

For characters, suits are correlated with certain themes:


Spades: Violence, especially excessive, merciless violence.
Hearts: Love, lust, seduction, and any strong emotion.
Clubs: Determination, willpower, endurance, overcoming odds & suffering.
Diamonds: Intellect, strategy, orchestration, organization, learned skills.

204786.name: One Piece D20
204786.description:
From the introduction:

One Piece D20 is a tabletop fantasy game in which the players take on the roles of heroes who form a group (or crew) and set out on dangerous adventures. Helping them tell the story is the Dungeon Master, who decides which threats the player characters face and what sorts of rewards they earn for succeeding at their quests and goals.
...
One Piece is a Japanese shōnen manga series written and illustrated by Eiichiro Oda. The first manga chapter was released August 4, 1997 so as of today the series has been around for about 15 years and is still going. There are currently 530+ anime episodes released which follow the manga series, 11 movies (10 of them outside of the canon storyline), and many videos games that are, for the most part, only available in Japan. One Piece is the most popular manga series of all time in Japan and one of the most popular manga series worldwide. It is the highest-selling manga in the history of Weekly Shōnen Jump and has received wide critical acclaim primarily for its art, characterization, humor, and story.

The series follows Monkey D. Luffy as he begins his life as a pirate and starts his adventure to find One Piece. One Piece is a legendary treasure left behind by the famous executed Pirate King Gol D. Roger. Along the way, Luffy makes a lot of friends, which in this series are referred to as “nakama”. Nakama are more than just friends though; it more closely means comrade or extended family member. Some of Luffy’s nakama join his crew and together they go on adventures with the ultimate goal of reaching the end of the Grand Line. The Grand Line is the most dangerous ocean in the world, full of mysterious islands and giant sea monsters. Each crew member has unique combat and non-combat abilities and they all play off each other’s strengths and weaknesses.

User summary:

This product licenses itself under the GNU Free Documentation License Version 1.3, 3 November 2008. However, it in turn appears to be an unlicensed adaptation of the well-known manga to the tabletop.

204787.name: Stay, Still (2016)
204787.description:
A Freeform LARP

From the introduction:

Stay, Still is a post-apocalyptic storytelling game about giving a stronger voice to the supporting characters in popular media, and about the difficult choices we need to make to survive. It is a free-form larp for a small group of people interested in peaceful arguments, collaboration, and speaking in code.

User summary:

This commercially published game is a revised, updated, and expanded version of an eponymous Game Chef 2015 finalist game.

204788.name: Rolling Thunder (Issue 1 - Jul 2016)
rpgissuearticle: A Hello from the Purveyors of Fine Imaginings

204789.name: Lord Mayor
204789.description:
A strategy game that lets you build cities, solve puzzles and create an empire!

Source: The Game Website.

204790.name: Lovely Planet Arcade
204790.description:
Relive your journey to Lovely Planet in this brand new adventure packed with impossible tests of skill and patience. Craft intricate combos to unfold the complex puzzle of flying projectiles and moving targets into a graceful sequence of well timed shots and jumps.

Source: The Developer Website.

204791.name: Death Road to Canada
videogamehonor: 2016 CVA Best PC Game of the Year Nominee
204791.description:
Control a car full of jerks as they explore cities, recruit weird people, rescue dogs, argue with each other, and face gigantic swarms of slow zombies. Randomly generated for a new story and rare events every time you play!

Source: The Game Website.

204792.name: Zombie City Defense 2
204792.description:
User Summary

In a near future, the world has been devastated by a virus turning humanity into zombies.

204793.name: Hail Caesar:  The Conquest of Gaul
204793.description:
Hail Caesar is a game of tabletop battles with model soldiers set in the Ancients era. Pit your wits and tactics against your friends as your armies clash in combat on the tabletop.

The Conquest of Gaul starter set gives you two starter forces the barbaric Celts and the legions of Imperial Rome and the glorious Hail ­Caesar rulebook.

This boxed game is just the start of your journey to conquer all comers and write your name in the annals of history!

Hail ­Caesar - Conquest of Gaul contains:

Full-colour 192 ­page hardback Hail ­Caesar rulebook

94 multi-pose, hard plastic 28mm miniatures:

30 Imperial ­Roman Legionaries
Roman Scorpion catapult and crew
60 Celt Warriors

204794.name: The Away Team
204794.description:
In this interactive sci-fi adventure novel, you are the AI pilot of Earth's last interstellar ship, tasked with finding a home for your crew—the last remnants of humanity. Your choices will determine their fate, and your own.

Source: The Game Website.

204795.name: 1 Moment Of Time: Silentville
204795.description:
This is the story of Silentville - a town with no future, no past and no present. A town lost to forever - unless someone can solve the mystery and release Silentville from its cursed non-existence. But should that someone fail, they will be trapped in Silentville... forever!

Source: The Publisher Website.

204796.name: Return Zero VR
204796.description:
Return Zero VR is a­ beautiful,­ psychedelic,­ ultrafast VR tunnel racer. If racing past mad-fast, frantic mazes set out in virtual, TRON like worlds is your thing, then Return Zero VR is definitely the game for you. Collect blue gates to gain speed while avoiding the red and yellow ones.

Source: The Developer Website.

204797.name: Pike & Shotte: For King and the Country
204797.description:
Pike & Shotte is a game of tabletop battles with model soldiers set in the 17th century. Pit your wits and tactics against your friends as armies clash in massed combat.

This starter set gives you the splendid Pike & Shotte rulebook and two starter forces field them as Royalist or Parliamentarian in the English Civil Wars or as one of the many protagonists involved in the immense Thirty Years War.

This boxed game is only the beginning, as you battle all-comers and reinforce your army further in the pursuit of glory...

Pike & Shotte - For King & Country contains:

Full-colour 208-page hardback Pike & Shotte rulebook

82 multi-pose, hard plastic 28mm miniatures:

58 pike and musket including command
12 Cavalry
12 infantry with Firelocks

204798.name: Aventuria: Schwarzes Auge Promokarte
204798.description:
The first promo card for the Adventure card game Aventuria. Its text reads:

Würfelst du bei einer Probe oder einem Angriff mit dem W20 eine 1, darfst du 2 statt 1 Karte vom Zugstapel ziehen. Würfelst du eine 20, musst du keine Handkarte ablegen.

The card's text roughly translates as:

"If you roll a 1 on a D20 while attacking or checking a success you may draw two cards instead of one. If you roll a 20, you do not have to discard a card."

204799.name: Queen Strike
204799.description:
Queen Strike combines a 3D holographic display with a traditional board game to bring you a new and exciting interactive experience. As little heroes of the "Music Kingdom", your quest is to collect musical notes in the kingdom and complete the fabled "Rainbow Score". Begin your adventure from one of the four starting points. Overcome treacherous traps set by the "Queen of Hearts" as she seeks discord! Roll the dice, explore different areas, and thwart the queen's plan by defeating her guards. Get to the castle, undo the queen's magic spell, and save the kingdom!

Queen Strike is a co-operative game. Players take turns rolling the movement dice and moving their hero pawn along the game map to collect the musical notes. They might encounter the Queen's guard and enter the "combat mode" displayed in the 3D holographic platform (driven by a game app on the player's own tablet), in which players need to use their combat cards to defeat the guard (in a rock-paper-scissors system). Players might also run into some event cards that bring them some surprise animation in the holographic movie. Once the players collect enough musical notes, they may challenge the Queen to win the game!
